Description: Brown-streaked goethite cylinder seal; the king with a mace faces the suppliant goddess; between them are a star-disc and crescent above a monkey. In the space previously occupied by an inscription, now totally erased, are two small kilted figures, one above the other, facing right with one hand raised (there is insufficient space for the lower one but in the case part of his body is missing due to a chip); a nude goddess; chipped; probably ground down and recut.
Bibliographic references: Collon 1986a / Catalogue of the Western Asiatic Seals in the British Museum: Cylinder Seals III: Isin-Larsa and Old Babylonian Periods (286)
Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.300)
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
